page.title: 06FARM NEAR TEMPLE NORMANTON
page.content: High House Farm near Temple Normanton covers an area of 500 acres. Mr. Eric Taylor, who owns the farm, has been farming since the age of 14. Farm buildings include the farmhouse, Dutch barns, pig sties, cow sheds and a large workshop. The 17th century farm house is a listed building standing on the highest point in the district. It is also a National Trig Point. On the chimney is a transmitter which is used by police to send messages to Sheffield and London. The farm specialises in the hiring out and maintenance of farm machinery. Trained mechanics carry out repairs in the large workshop. Mr. Taylor is the main contractor of farm machinery to the National Coal Board in the Derbyshire area.
